title: How to Make the Starship Enterprise (NCC 1701 D) from Aluminum Foil

steps.headline: Be sure to familiarize yourself with the contours of the starship Enterprise.
steps.description: For the purposes of this article, we are creating a replica of the U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-D.

steps.headline: Take a sheet of aluminum foil and cut off a sheet as the core main section of the ship.
Tighten up the centerpiece of foil.
steps.description: Keep in mind that this is just the base.

steps.headline: Use your fingers to create the pylons that will support the nacelles (will want the pylons to be over extended).
steps.description: Take two separate pieces of foil. One over each pylons to create the desired nacelle.

steps.headline: Depending on how the ship is forming, you may want to add additional pieces of foil to reinforce the neck, lower body and the pylons of the ship.
Create the nacelles of the ship and attach the nacelles to the pylons.
steps.description: this may require additional pieces of foil over the pylons.

steps.headline: Create the saucer section of the ship.
steps.description: cut three pieces of foil, the first should be balled up. The other will be used to surround the balled up piece of foil.

steps.headline: Attach the saucer section to the neck of the ship.
Apply cover foil to rough areas of the ship.

text: Be sure to familiarize yourself with the contours of the starship Enterprise. For the purposes of this article, we are creating a replica of the U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701-D. Take a sheet of aluminum foil and cut off a sheet as the core main section of the ship.  Tighten up the centerpiece of foil. Keep in mind that this is just the base. Use your fingers to create the pylons that will support the nacelles (will want the pylons to be over extended). Take two separate pieces of foil. One over each pylons to create the desired nacelle. Depending on how the ship is forming, you may want to add additional pieces of foil to reinforce the neck, lower body and the pylons of the ship.  Create the nacelles of the ship and attach the nacelles to the pylons. this may require additional pieces of foil over the pylons. Create the saucer section of the ship. cut three pieces of foil, the first should be balled up. The other will be used to surround the balled up piece of foil. Attach the saucer section to the neck of the ship.  Apply cover foil to rough areas of the ship.  Enjoy!
